Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Louisiana gets "not one single penny" from Gulf Coast offshore oil revenues, when in fact, the state does receive millions of dollars in royalties.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Louisiana receives no revenue from offshore oil royalties, which is not entirely accurate as the state does receive a portion of the royalties from certain areas.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement that Louisiana receives no money from offshore oil revenues.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim as it is explained that Louisiana does receive royalties from offshore oil drilling, but the amount varies depending on the distance from the shoreline.
